alert.note: Alert for Alexander; Pulaski (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 15 at 11:33PM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Pulaski, southeastern Alexander, north central Fulton, western Carlisle, northwestern Hickman, southern Ballard, Mississippi, southeastern Scott and northeastern New Madrid Counties through 1215 AM CST... At 1133 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Bertrand to near Towosahgy State Historic Site. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Charleston around 1140 PM CST. Wyatt around 1145 PM CST. Bardwell around 1150 PM CST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Cairo, Wickliffe, Mound City, Horseshoe Lake Conservation Area, Olive Branch, Mounds, Barlow and La Center. This includes the following highways... Interstate 57 in Illinois between Mile Markers 1 and 9. Interstate 57 in Missouri between Mile Markers 3 and 21. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CST for southern Illinois...western Kentucky...and southeastern Missouri.
